Class BattleEvent

java.lang.Object
events.models.BattleEvent
All Implemented Interfaces:
Event, Serializable
public class BattleEvent extends Object implements Event
The BattleEvent class implements the Event interface. This class is responsible for carrying out the battles during gameplay.
See Also:

    • eventCommands

      private Map<String,Supplier<Double>> eventCommands
      Holds the commands that are specific for this event. The key represent the name of the command. The values are the commands for the player attacks, that will be executed, when being called.

    • startEvent

      public void startEvent(Player player) throws Exception
      This is an implementation of the Event.startEvent(Player) method. The method starts the event by deciding who attacks first. Both the player and the monster take turns to attack. The event ends, when one of them dies. If the player dies. The game is over. If the player survives, it heals a certain percentage of the health, depending on the health after the battle. The player heals 50% of the initial health if is under 50% of the current health. If the current health is above the half mark, the player heals 25% of the initial health.
      Specified by:
      startEvent in interface Event
      Parameters:
      player - The player that has encountered the monster
      Throws:
      Exception - Exceptions that happen during the event.

    • selectAttack

      private double selectAttack() throws IOException
      Handles all the commands of the event. If an event command is detected, the result of the attack will be returned.
      Returns:
      The attack points, that will be dealt to the monster
      Throws:
      IOException - If an error occurs with reading the user input

    • help

      private void help()
      Shows all supported event commands on the system's default output stream.
